Ad Text:

We're executing a high-impact innovation roadmap and need an AI Engineer who can plug into a fast-moving delivery pipeline.

Overview


The Azure Core Trusted Platform team safeguards Microsoft‚Äôs foundational cloud infrastructure by ensuring that our engineering systems, services, and workflows meet the highest bars for security, privacy, and regulatory compliance. Microsoft runs on trust, and we build the platform‚Äëlevel capabilities that make safe‚Äëby‚Äëdefault, compliant engineering possible across Azure, embedding transparency, traceability, and automated safeguards directly into how engineers build and operate services.

Our work increasingly leverages AI through agentic workflows, intelligent automation, and privacy‚Äëaware generation and validation to solve traditionally complex compliance and safety challenges in scalable, creative ways.

As a Software Engineer on the team, you‚Äôll work deeply in distributed systems, reliability, debugging, secure coding, cloud security, automation, and CI/CD, applying strong engineering fundamentals to build resilient, compliant platform components used across Microsoft.

Privacy Manager is a core part of this mission, providing the unified platform that helps hundreds of Microsoft engineering teams understand, track, and confidently manage how their services use, store, and move data. It brings together automated data‚Äëflow insights, privacy‚Äëaware tooling, and structured review workflows that make compliance easier to adopt and harder to get wrong. By integrating these capabilities directly into engineering processes, Privacy Manager enables teams to make informed decisions, reduce risk, and meet evolving global regulatory expectations without slowing down innovation.If you‚Äôre excited by the intersection of large‚Äëscale systems, compliance engineering, and AI‚Äëpowered innovation, you‚Äôll find a team that values curiosity, impact, and building the trusted foundations Microsoft and its customers rely on.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Understanding User Requirements: Partner with product, security, privacy, and other stakeholders to determine and translate customer and user needs into feature requirements, continuously improving solutions based on user insights.

Design & Architecture: Support identification of dependencies and contribute to architecture and feature design by evaluating options, developing design documents with oversight, and ensuring scalability, security, and testability through cross‚Äëteam collaboration.

AI‚ÄëNative Development: Use AI tools responsibly across the software development lifecycle, validating and reviewing AI‚Äëgenerated changes with strong engineering discipline.

Coding & Implementation: With guidance, create and implement high‚Äëquality, secure, and maintainable code by reusing existing components where applicable; break down work items into tasks, provide estimates, and execute features safely, including managing deployments, rollbacks, and experiments using flighting and metrics.

Engineering Excellence: Apply secure design principles, improve tooling and automation, enforce security and compliance standards, and drive consistent, high‚Äëquality engineering practices.

Reliability & Supportability: Act as a Designated Responsible Individual (DRI) for simple issues by monitoring systems, product features, or services for degradation, downtime, or interruptions; follow established playbooks to recommend and execute recovery actions.

Live‚ÄëSite Operations: Support live‚Äësite operations through on‚Äëcall rotations, resolve incidents, and maintain reliable services by improving monitoring, telemetry, and operational readiness.

Continuous Improvement: Review current developments and proactively seek new knowledge to improve the availability, reliability, efficiency, observability, and performance of products while driving consistency in monitoring and operations at scale.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline with proven experience coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python

OR equivalent experience.

1+ years of expereince in the relevant fields mentioned.¬†

Other Requirements:

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:¬†

Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Preferred Qualifications:

Master's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field with proven experience coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python

OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 2+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python

OR equivalent experience.

#EiP

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. Digital Building Engineer

Join Switch Automation and help shape the future of smart buildings.

The Digital Building Engineer is a customer-facing technical lead responsible for deploying and optimising the Switch Smart Building Platform across commercial property portfolios. Operating at the intersection of building services engineering, data analytics, and cloud software, you will integrate building systems, configure fault detection and optimisation logic, and translate HVAC performance data into measurable operational improvements. Working closely with customers, site teams, and internal product and engineering resources, you will ensure accurate data ingestion, scalable deployment, and sustained performance outcomes. This is a non-traditional engineering role for professionals who want to apply deep HVAC expertise in a modern, data-driven environment and help build the next generation of intelligent, high-performing buildings.

A Bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent qualification is required for this position.

Experience

Successful candidates will meet the following minimum requirements:

- Detail oriented engineer with 2+ years of experience in building services industry

- Working knowledge of HVAC systems & controls strategies

- Comfortable leading meetings and interacting directly with customers

- Australian work rights are required for this position

Preference will be given to candidates who also possess the following:

- Data skills [KQL, SQL, Python]

- Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

- Commercial acumen and understanding of property operations

- CCNA/networking knowledge

Day to Day Responsibilities

Primary Duties

I Implement and configure of the Switch Platform for client specific sites and portfolios by integrating new buildings and building systems into the Switch Platform

I Configure fault detection and performance optimization logic

I Perform engineering analysis on building systems to identify and register performance issues and propose improvements and optimization opportunities

I Conduct regular meetings and communications with building site teams and vendors to drive action on performance optimization opportunities

I Design and build visualizations to support customer programs and key impact metrics

I Train new users and provide ongoing software support to customers

I Provide project support for data integration, ongoing collection, manipulation and analysis: from hardware (meters, control systems, Switch Appliances) to software and flat files

I Perform project and account management responsibilities to drive customer success

I Provide software feedback and testing to the product team using your expertise to suggest meaningful improvements to the Switch Platform

Secondary Duties

I Develop commercial and solutioning skills for interactions with perspective customers as part of demonstrations

I Learn and develop technical training materials for internal and external users of the software

I Constantly update knowledge and learning of the industry, the competitive landscape, the Switch Platform and ancillary technologies through ongoing personal development

I Foster and promote fellow team members by sharing information, education, learnings and introductions

I Schedule tasks for younger members of the team and provide feedback/training to upskill the team

Key Performance Metrics

I Completion of project deliverables on time and according to customer expectations

I Application of engineering skills to support the optimization of building operations

I Work collaboratively internally and externally for the integrity of customer objectives

I Develop good relationships with clients and the Switch team, fosters and promote all team members by sharing information, education, learnings and management

Python / AWS Developer

3 Month Contract | Immediate Start | Melbourne




We are currently partnering with a Melbourne-based technology team seeking a Python / AWS Developer for an initial 3-month contract engagement, with strong potential for extension.

This is a hands-on delivery role focused on building and extending serverless AWS components within an existing solution. You‚Äôll be working from an established proof of concept and helping productionise and scale the architecture.

This role will suit someone confident working independently, comfortable making technical decisions, and experienced in designing event-driven cloud systems.




Key Responsibilities

Develop AWS Lambda functions using Python

Build and enhance event-driven workflows

Work with messaging services and queue-based systems

Integrate with SQL/RDS data stores

Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines (GitHub)

Take ownership of delivery with minimal oversight




Required Experience

Strong Python development experience

Solid AWS experience (Lambda, messaging services, RDS/SQL)

Experience building serverless architectures

Understanding of event-driven design patterns

Experience working autonomously in contract environments




Nice to Have

Exposure to .NET development

Experience working on data or AI-related projects

Australian citizenship (not mandatory but preferred)




What‚Äôs on Offer

Competitive daily rate (up to $1,000 per day ‚Äì flexibility for the right candidate)

Immediate start

3-month initial term with extension potential

Two-stage interview process (technical design-focused)




If you‚Äôre an experienced AWS / Python engineer looking for your next contract opportunity and available to start quickly, apply now or reach out directly for a confidential discussion.

We currently have an exciting new opportunity for a proactive and ambitious Aviation Operations Specialist to join our Aviation Operations team.

The Aviation Operations Specialist is a key driver for maintaining safe, efficient, and resilient airport operations across Melbourne Airport‚Äôs airfield, terminal, and baggage environments. The role develops operational oversight metrics, SMS intelligence, enhances operational collaboration, and supports stakeholders to uphold safety, compliance, and passenger experience standards.

This position plays a critical role in building analytics, developing executive reports, streamlining stakeholder communication, and continuous improvement across the airport‚Äôs operating ecosystems

Explore how we are thinking big with exciting projects like the Third Runway, state-of-the-art terminals, and thriving business park developments. You can also learn more about life at Melbourne Airport ‚Äì our culture, values, and what makes us unique at https://www.melbourneairport.com.au/corporate/our-culture-and-values. Join us in shaping the future of aviation as we propel Melbourne Airport towards becoming Australia's favourite Airport destination.

Key responsibilities:

The role's duties and accountabilities include, but are not limited to:

Operational Oversight & Airport Performance Monitoring

Analyse operational data sources to identify patterns, performance changes and emerging issues.
Use reporting tools (Power BI / Excel) to provide evidence‚Äëbased insights that drive operational decision‚Äëmaking.
Utilise operational data points such as aircraft movements, load factors, on time performance, queue times and resource performance to create dashboards that help inform key decision makers within Aviation Operations.
Identify emerging operational risks or congestion points using data‚Äëdriven insights and develop early warning indicators that can help inform stakeholders.

Safety, Compliance, Regulatory Support & Risk Management

Support compliance with Civil Aviation Safety Regulations (CASR), ICAO requirements, IATA guidelines, Melbourne

Airport operating standards and internal procedures.

Participate in safety forums and operational readiness assessments, ensuring risk controls remain effective and aligned to operational changes.
Support the development and maintenance of critical risks, documenting hazards, critical controls, mitigations, accountabilities and residual risk levels.
Provide risk‚Äëbased insights during planning for airport works, operational trials, irregular operations, major disruptions and peak‚Äëperiod operations.

AI, Automation & Digital Operational Intelligence

Contribute to AI‚Äëenabled operational capability uplift, including AI‚Äëgenerated reporting, automated data collection, and enhanced situational awareness tools.
Collaborate with technology partners to validate data models, refine solution designs, and ensure operational accuracy in AI agent workflows.
Provide operational SME input for digital, analytics and automation projects to ensure solutions align to real airport practices and data readiness.

Operations Continuous Improvement

Use reporting tools (Power BI / Excel) to provide evidence‚Äëbased insights that drive operational continuous Improvement.
Support the production and continuous improvement of daily, weekly and monthly operational performance reports, including the 24‚Äëhour airport report.
Investigate operational incidents, service failures or disruptions and contribute to corrective action plans.

The successful candidate will have:

Bachelor or Diploma in Aviation Management (preferred)
Understanding of critical risk methodology (highly desirable)
Ability to use specialist Microsoft tools (e.g. PowerBI, Power Automate and Co-Pilot)
Operational experience in passenger‚Äëfocused airport environment (airfield, terminal, and baggage operations).
Strong working knowledge of airport operations, including aircraft turnarounds, passenger flow, baggage systems and safety risk mitigation.
Understanding of aviation operational standards (e.g., CASA regulation).
Experience contributing to an Aviation Safety Management Systems, in particularly safety performance monitoring.
Proven ability to develop resolutions to operational issues to help leaders make informed decisions.
Demonstrated stakeholder engagement skills, working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders.
Analytical capability to interpret operational data, identify inefficiencies and support continuous improvement initiatives.
A passion for building artificial intelligence solutions that simplifies business processes.
Strong written/verbal communication skills, including executive reporting, briefing notes, and operational updates

We understand that not everyone will feel they meet all of these 100%. However, if you feel you have the attitude and aptitude to grow within our team, we invite you to apply and have a conversation with us about this position.

About the Company:

Melbourne Airport (Australia Pacific Airports Corporation) is proud to be one of Australia's premier transport hubs and Victoria's gateway to the world, connecting us to the global marketplace. We are committed to creating connections that matter and enhancing the traveller experience across every aspect of our organisation to deliver our vision of becoming Australia's favourite Airport destination. Currently, in an exciting phase of change, we are delivering rewarding career opportunities, making Melbourne Airport a dynamic and fast-paced place to work for our people.

APAC is a majority Australian-owned private company that also operates Launceston Airport, the tourism gateway to Tasmania and an industry multi-award-winning airport.

Culture and Values:

By joining the team at Melbourne Airport, you will work within a friendly, high-performance culture with a focus on our people and their development.

Our vision is to become Australia's favourite Airport destination and our people are paramount to achieving this success. We provide a supportive environment, with values that encourage all of our employees to Be You, Think Big, Own it and Work Together.

Benefits:

Free access to Higher State, our state-of-the-art Fitness Club & Wellness Hub at Novotel & ibis Styles Airport hotel.
Airport car parking 24 hours/365 days a year for both business and personal use
Hybrid flexible working arrangements
Airport Holiday, an additional day of leave
Wellness Day, a further additional day of leave
Discounted onsite childcare at Creative Garden Early Learning
Mental health and well-being initiatives, including Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Long-term career and professional development opportunities
Active social culture and participation in a range of social impact days and activities
Signature Experiences including an airfield family day
Access to an employee benefits scheme including access to corporate rates and airport retailer discounts (including SkyBus)

APAC is committed to weaving Diversity into our DNA. We believe that Diversity and Inclusion will help us realise our greatest potential as a company, and maximise the potential of all our team members. We strive to create a culture where our team members understand that each individual is unique and that embracing diversity makes us more flexible, productive, and creative.

APAC provides equal opportunity and advancement in employment regardless of gender, age, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, cultural background, caring responsibilities, disability or socioeconomic background. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds who share our workplace values of Being You, Thinking Big, Owning It and Working Together.

Ad Text:
Employment type ‚Äì full time continuing role as a Senior Data Engineer, working within UNSW IT
Starting salary $148012 plus generous superannuation and leave loading
Location: UNSW Kensington Campus (Hybrid Working Opportunities, 2 days in the office)

About UNSW:
UNSW isn‚Äôt like other places you‚Äôve worked. Yes, we‚Äôre a large organisation with a diverse and talented community, a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you‚Äôre in the right place.

UNSW IT is part of UNSW‚Äôs Division of Operations and provides high quality, sustainable, flexible products and state of the art services to UNSW. Our priorities are to drive innovative architectures that enable UNSW‚Äôs digital future and be a trusted partner of the University. This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions on UNSW‚Äôs data platform. The Senior Data Engineer is responsible for building, implementing, and supporting data solutions and integration components using data technology components. This role combines expertise in data engineering, data modeling, Master Data Management (MDM), and DevOps practices to ensure efficient data pipelines, reliable deployments, and optimal performance of data systems. The position reports to the Lead Solution Architect - MDM and Data and has no direct reports.

Specific accountabilities for this role include:

Lead the development, configuration and implementation of MDM, canonical data models, data persistence layers, data ingestion components, and components integrated into business applications.
Lead the continuous improvement and scale of MDM, central data models, data persistence layers, data ingestion components, and components integrated into business applications.
Provide expert technical and engineering support of MDM, central data models, data persistence layers, data ingestion components, and components integrated into business applications.
Enhance the UNSW IT standard integration platform based on the Microsoft technology stack through collaboration with wider colleagues (including but not limited to Architects, Engineers) and aligned with industry trends and best practise.
Analyse specific requirements and architectures to design appropriate objects and methods for implementing functional and non-functional requirements.
Guide developers, vendor SI and coordinate with internal organisational units and suppliers during implementation to ensure deliverables are met.
Organise infrastructure or data/integration platform changes to integrate applications into the technology landscape.
Design and implement relational database schemas, build data ingestion, transformation, and harmonization pipelines in the Microsoft Azure Platform, and develop SQL queries for data collection from relational databases and data sources.
Proactively manage complex risks, issues, and financials and work with the team to find appropriate solutions.
Support leadership in optimising the Application Integration & Data Services work, including practices, organisation, and resourcing for continuous improvement.
Oversee effective communications with key stakeholders, internal and external, and provide influential input to achieve business outcomes.

Who you are:

Tertiary qualifications in IT or a related discipline, with 7+ years of experience in software development using Cloud architectures and middleware components.
Extensive experience in enterprise master data management platforms, data engineering technologies, data modelling, integration, and data design practice, including SQL queries and database schemas.
Hands-on experience with Informatica Cloud MDM / Customer 360 / Product 360 with expertise in match & merge rules, survivorship logic, hierarchies, workflows, and Golden Record creation. Informatica experience would be essential as this is our key platform.
Proficiency in designing and implementing solutions using Azure data services (MS SQL, Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Lake, Azure Storage Accounts, Azure Service Bus).
Experience with a diverse array of synchronous and asynchronous integration patterns (e.g., API, ESB, ETL) in appropriate settings.
Strong skills in ETL/ELT tools (Informatica PowerCenter, IDMC, Azure Data Factory)
Extensive experience with the development of data solutions to support API integrations. ‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of application, data, and API security and privacy controls.
Experience with Azure DevOps and CI/CD tools for automated testing and deployment of data related solutions and database schema changes.
Knowledge of system integration methods, products, tools, development life cycle, and their impact on integrated solutions.
Knowledge of technical products like Terraform, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Databricks, Artifactory, and productivity applications like Git, Jira, and Confluence is preferred.
Advanced written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail.
Excellent time management skills, ability to respond to changing priorities, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
Familiarity with Agile Project Management methodologies and experience in participating in storyboarding, estimation, and using project management tools.
An understanding of and commitment to UNSW‚Äôs aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines.
Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.

Benefits and Culture

Flexible Working Options (work from home, flexible hours etc)¬†
Career development opportunities
17% Superannuation contributions and additional leave loading payments¬†
Additional 3 days of leave over Christmas period
Discounts and entitlements (retail, education, fitness)

For further details on the benefits, please visit¬†https://www.jobs.unsw.edu.au/lifestyle-benefits

How to Apply: please apply through the portal, we would like you to submit a full application including resume and addressing the who you are section.

Applications close: 8th of March at 11.30pm

Pre-Employment Checks
Aligned with UNSW‚Äôs focus on cultivating a workplace defined by safety, ethical conduct, and strong integrity preferred candidates will be required to participate in a combination of pre-employment checks relevant to the role they have applied for.

These pre-employment checks may include a combination of some of the following checks:-¬†

National and International Criminal history checks
Entitlement to work and ID checks
Working With Children Checks
Completion of a Gender-Based Violence Prevention Declaration
Verification of relevant qualifications
Verification of relevant professional membership
Employment history and reference checks
Financial responsibility assessments/checks.
Medical Checks and Assessments

Compliance with the necessary combination of these checks is a condition of employment at UNSW.

Get in Touch:

Jen MacLachlan

j.maclachlan@unsw.edu.au

Talent Acquisition Partner ‚Äì UNSW IT

Please apply through the application portal and not via the contact above.

UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff. The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

About LEAP

LEAP is the leading provider of Legal Practice Management Solutions in the world and is part of ATI ‚Äì one of the largest international LegalTech companies. For more than 30 years, our curiosity and commitment to continual improvement has kept us reimagining productivity tools for lawyers and their staff to support our guiding purpose, to ‚ÄòHelp lawyers who help people‚Äô. The market-leading software we develop, and support is used by more than 71,000 lawyers and their staff in small and medium-sized law firms.

Working alongside our international team of passionate high achievers, you‚Äôll join a fast-growing technology business where things seldom stay the same for long. With more than 1000 smart, caring and ambitious ‚ÄòLEAPsters‚Äô working together across Australia, Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, Poland and New Zealand, you‚Äôll find yourself in good company here.

Meet the Global Business Systems team
We‚Äôre a fast-growing business built on cutting-edge technology, and our Global Business Systems team are the experts who keep everything running seamlessly while helping us stay ahead of the curve.

From ensuring our people have the right tools and technology, to using data and analytics to solve complex business challenges, to digitising and improving the way we work, this team sits at the heart of how we scale and evolve. They combine technical expertise with commercial thinking to power both our internal success and the experience we deliver to our clients.

If you‚Äôre a tech-savvy problem solver with ambition and a drive to make a real impact, this is your opportunity to build a meaningful career while helping shape the future of LegalTech.

What you'll do

As the AI/ML Software Engineer you‚Äôll evolve the intelligence layer behind AskLEAP, our AI-powered helpdesk solution that answers 6,000 to 8,000 customer questions each month. This is a backend-leaning full stack role where you will design and build the retrieval and orchestration layer that sits between the application and the information it relies on. Today, AskLEAP draws primarily from curated content sources. You‚Äôll expand its robustness and context-awareness by integrating additional structured and unstructured data sources, including internal systems, customer instance and environment data, and third-party platforms such as Salesforce.

You‚Äôll define and implement the decision and orchestration logic behind our AI agents, determining what information is required, how it is retrieved, how tools are invoked, and how responses are generated in a grounded, reliable, and observable way. Working closely with Engineering, Product, Analytics, and Content, you‚Äôll ensure our AI systems are aligned with defined business rules and deliver trusted, real-world outcomes.

Beyond AskLEAP, this role helps establish reusable AI orchestration and retrieval patterns that can support future AI-enabled products, including use cases that leverage structured business data and governed metrics from our enterprise analytics platform.

To make this happen, you will look after:

AI agent and intelligence layer

Design and implement retrieval and context assembly pipelines across structured and unstructured data sources
Build and manage LLM orchestration logic, including routing, tool usage, multi-step workflows, confidence thresholds, and fallback strategies
Ensure responses are grounded in authoritative data sources and governed business metrics, preserving metric definitions and business logic integrity throughout AI workflows
Create evaluation and regression frameworks to monitor accuracy, consistency, and reliability over time
Develop reusable orchestration patterns and standardised tool interfaces that form the foundation for scalable AI capabilities across multiple business domains
Partner with Analytics to integrate structured semantic-layer outputs (governed business metrics and APIs) alongside unstructured knowledge sources into AI agent workflows
Implement logging, monitoring, and observability for AI workflows to ensure transparency and production reliability

Backend engineering (70%)

Develop and scale .NET 8 APIs and services powering AI features
Integrate LLM APIs, including streaming and tool-calling patterns
Implement secure authentication, validation, logging, and error handling
Improve reliability, performance, and scalability of AI-enabled services
Contribute to CI/CD, Docker-based deployments, and production optimisation

Frontend collaboration (30%)

Work within React and TypeScript applications to deliver AI functionality end to end
Build or adapt UI components to support AI interactions
Collaborate with frontend engineers to ensure seamless integration and user experience

What you'll bring

3+ years of software development experience
Strong C# and .NET experience including ASP.NET Core, REST APIs, middleware, and dependency injection
Comfortable contributing to React and TypeScript when needed
Experience building and operating LLM-based systems in production environments
Hands-on experience with RAG or similar retrieval-based AI patterns, including vector databases or embeddings
Experience evaluating and improving LLM outputs for grounding, confidence, and consistency
Experience deploying to AWS using Docker or similar cloud and container environments
Solid understanding of HTTP, API security such as OAuth and JWT, and production performance debugging
Working proficiency in Python for AI and data workflows

Consider it a bonus if you have:

Experience building multi-step agent or tool-calling workflows
Experience working with structured business data or governed metrics
Experience implementing AI evaluation or monitoring frameworks
Enterprise system integrations such as Salesforce
DevOps exposure including CI/CD, containerisation, or infrastructure as code

Tech Stack

Frontend: React, TypeScript, Vite
Backend: .NET 8, ASP.NET Core, REST APIs
Infrastructure: AWS, Docker
AI Integrations: OpenAI / LLM APIs
Enterprise Integrations: Salesforce

You are the type of person who

Has a collaborative, proactive mindset and you‚Äôre comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
Has strong communication skills, able to translate technical concepts into business outcomes.
Is a self-starter attitude with a willingness to learn, experiment, and take ownership of tasks.
Is a team player who understands that diverse opinions make a team and the benefit of achieving goals and decisions together.
Is curious - you're not afraid to ask questions, explore and share your thoughts and ideas.

LEAP is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

Why join LEAP?

Your work matters. Helping lawyers help people sits at the heart of everything we do. We solve real world problems that improve and support local, everyday law firms. So they can do their best work for the people in the communities they serve.
Make an impact. You won‚Äôt be another ‚Äòcog in the wheel‚Äô here. We give full trust and autonomy for you to be heard, to work on big & complex projects ‚Äì and to make a real difference.
Work with a group of authentic, passionate people who love what they do.
Flexible and hybrid working. We'd like to find this person in Sydney, but we want you to work in a way that suits you and we're open to flexible arrangements that support you.
Grow your career with us. Our founder Christian Beck has been building legal tech businesses for over 30 years. There are opportunities galore to expand your career based on where your interests lie. We're not afraid to pivot based on market conditions - you will always have the opportunity to stay ahead of the curve and do your best work here.
Have fun with us. Celebrations. Socials. Sports teams. Access to sailing and yacht events.
We value your well-being - enjoy an additional paid wellbeing day every year, free gym membership, corporate dental plan and weekly massages in the office.
Work in a new, beautiful office space ‚Äì with a catered lunch and breakfast every week, fully stocked kitchen and an on-site barista.
Access to LEAP Home - a program unique to LEAP to support you in buying your primary residence.¬†

Role Overview

Our customer, a leading financial institution with a market-leading, innovation-driven legal team, is seeking a Legal Engineer to support a high-priority AI and workflow transformation initiative. The role sits at the intersection of law, technology, workflow design, and AI delivery.

The Legal Engineer will work closely with digital leaders, legal SMEs, and transformation teams to design and automate high-impact legal workflows using Microsoft Copilot Studio and related LLM-powered environments.

This is a Sydney-based, full-time 6-month engagement with strong potential for extension. The role operates in a hybrid working model, with an immediate start.

Key Responsibilities

Identify and prioritise high-value (‚Äúhero‚Äù) legal workflows for automation.

Map and redesign legal workflows end-to-end in collaboration with lawyers and business teams.

Develop fast prototypes, incorporate feedback, and finalise production-ready workflows.

Navigate enterprise governance, ensuring solutions meet security, compliance, and risk requirements.

Integrate automated workflows with existing legal tools, including intake & triage systems.

Engage stakeholders, gather requirements, run demos, and support the adoption of AI-enabled processes.

Maintain clear documentation, version control, and quality standards across workflow delivery.

Required Experience & Qualifications

3‚Äì5+ years of experience, with a strong background in workflow automation, AI delivery, legal engineering, or business analysis.

Hands-on experience building agentic workflows using Copilot Studio or similar LLM platforms (Gemini, ChatGPT).

Excellent stakeholder communication skills, comfortable working directly with lawyers and senior leaders.

We currently have an exciting new opportunity for a proactive and ambitious Aviation Operations Specialist to join our Aviation Operations team.

The Aviation Operations Specialist is a key driver for maintaining safe, efficient, and resilient airport operations across Melbourne Airport‚Äôs airfield, terminal, and baggage environments. The role develops operational oversight metrics, SMS intelligence, enhances operational collaboration, and supports stakeholders to uphold safety, compliance, and passenger experience standards.

This position plays a critical role in building analytics, developing executive reports, streamlining stakeholder communication, and continuous improvement across the airport‚Äôs operating ecosystems

Explore how we are thinking big with exciting projects like the Third Runway, state-of-the-art terminals, and thriving business park developments. You can also learn more about life at Melbourne Airport ‚Äì our culture, values, and what makes us unique at https://www.melbourneairport.com.au/corporate/our-culture-and-values. Join us in shaping the future of aviation as we propel Melbourne Airport towards becoming Australia's favourite Airport destination.

Key responsibilities:

The role's duties and accountabilities include, but are not limited to:

Operational Oversight & Airport Performance Monitoring

Analyse operational data sources to identify patterns, performance changes and emerging issues.
Use reporting tools (Power BI / Excel) to provide evidence‚Äëbased insights that drive operational decision‚Äëmaking.
Utilise operational data points such as aircraft movements, load factors, on time performance, queue times and resource performance to create dashboards that help inform key decision makers within Aviation Operations.
Identify emerging operational risks or congestion points using data‚Äëdriven insights and develop early warning indicators that can help inform stakeholders.

Safety, Compliance, Regulatory Support & Risk Management

Support compliance with Civil Aviation Safety Regulations (CASR), ICAO requirements, IATA guidelines, Melbourne

Airport operating standards and internal procedures.

Participate in safety forums and operational readiness assessments, ensuring risk controls remain effective and aligned to operational changes.
Support the development and maintenance of critical risks, documenting hazards, critical controls, mitigations, accountabilities and residual risk levels.
Provide risk‚Äëbased insights during planning for airport works, operational trials, irregular operations, major disruptions and peak‚Äëperiod operations.

AI, Automation & Digital Operational Intelligence

Contribute to AI‚Äëenabled operational capability uplift, including AI‚Äëgenerated reporting, automated data collection, and enhanced situational awareness tools.
Collaborate with technology partners to validate data models, refine solution designs, and ensure operational accuracy in AI agent workflows.
Provide operational SME input for digital, analytics and automation projects to ensure solutions align to real airport practices and data readiness.

Operations Continuous Improvement

Use reporting tools (Power BI / Excel) to provide evidence‚Äëbased insights that drive operational continuous Improvement.
Support the production and continuous improvement of daily, weekly and monthly operational performance reports, including the 24‚Äëhour airport report.
Investigate operational incidents, service failures or disruptions and contribute to corrective action plans.

The successful candidate will have:

Bachelor or Diploma in Aviation Management (preferred)
Understanding of critical risk methodology (highly desirable)
Ability to use specialist Microsoft tools (e.g. PowerBI, Power Automate and Co-Pilot)
Operational experience in passenger‚Äëfocused airport environment (airfield, terminal, and baggage operations).

Experience contributing to an Aviation Safety Management Systems, in particularly safety performance monitoring.
Proven ability to develop resolutions to operational issues to help leaders make informed decisions.
Demonstrated stakeholder engagement skills, working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders.
Analytical capability to interpret operational data, identify inefficiencies and support continuous improvement initiatives.
A passion for building artificial intelligence solutions that simplifies business processes.

We understand that not everyone will feel they meet all of these 100%. However, if you feel you have the attitude and aptitude to grow within our team, we invite you to apply and have a conversation with us about this position.

About the Company:

Melbourne Airport (Australia Pacific Airports Corporation) is proud to be one of Australia's premier transport hubs and Victoria's gateway to the world, connecting us to the global marketplace. We are committed to creating connections that matter and enhancing the traveller experience across every aspect of our organisation to deliver our vision of becoming Australia's favourite Airport destination. Currently, in an exciting phase of change, we are delivering rewarding career opportunities, making Melbourne Airport a dynamic and fast-paced place to work for our people.

APAC is a majority Australian-owned private company that also operates Launceston Airport, the tourism gateway to Tasmania and an industry multi-award-winning airport.

Culture and Values:

By joining the team at Melbourne Airport, you will work within a friendly, high-performance culture with a focus on our people and their development.

Our vision is to become Australia's favourite Airport destination and our people are paramount to achieving this success. We provide a supportive environment, with values that encourage all of our employees to Be You, Think Big, Own it and Work Together.

Benefits:

Free access to Higher State, our state-of-the-art Fitness Club & Wellness Hub at Novotel & ibis Styles Airport hotel.

APAC is committed to weaving Diversity into our DNA. About the Opportunity
We're all here to deliver great retirement outcomes for our members and our Technology teams play a critical role in enabling that mission. In Delivery and Information, we sustain the health of UniSuper's core systems and platforms, partnering with the business to drive simplification, scale and delivery of the enterprise portfolio aligned to UniSuper's strategy.

This is a great opportunity for a strong, hands-on data engineering leader to step into a technical lead role that shapes how we design, build and operate modern data platforms and integration solutions while living our values of genuine care, being better together and a passion for outcomes.

The Delivery and Information team ensures the sustained health and maintenance of UniSuper's core systems and platforms, delivering high availability, stability and performance. We partner with business units to provide business-driven scale and simplification, and to deliver the enterprise portfolio and technologies that enable UniSuper's strategy

The Role
As Technical Lead - Data Engineering, you are accountable for providing hands-on technical leadership for a team of data engineers while remaining deeply engaged in solution design and delivery. You will guide the development, operation and continuous improvement of UniSuper's data platforms and integration solutions, ensuring they are robust, scalable and aligned with enterprise architecture and business outcomes.

You will be accountable for:


Providing technical leadership and day-to-day guidance to data engineers, building strong engineering practices and continuous learning
Translating business requirements and solution architecture into high-quality technical designs and implementations
Owning solution integrity (performance, reliability, supportability) across the full lifecycle
Contributing to platform evolution with focus on efficiency, reuse, scalability and security
Driving consistent engineering standards, CI/CD adoption and delivery improvements
Partnering across application, platform and integration teams for cohesive end-to-end outcomes
What You'll Do
Lead the design, development, testing and deployment of data solutions across Microsoft SQL Server and Azure
Be the technical escalation point for complex engineering tasks and production incidents
Ensure solutions meet NFRs (performance, availability, security and supportability)
Review designs and code for standards, quality and maintainability
Mentor and coach engineers across varying experience levels; uplift capability in modern tools and practices
Drive robust root cause analysis and deliver sustainable fixes to production data issues
Improve engineering discipline: documentation, testing, operational readiness and change management compliance
Embed cost-aware design, guiding cost optimisation and financial efficiency
Evolve CI/CD pipelines, automation and DevOps practices
Provide pragmatic data modelling guidance (fit-for-purpose, aligned to reporting/analytics needs)
Improve non-production testing/environment strategies (automated refresh/validation/data quality checks aligned to production changes)
Challenge ways of working to improve reliability, delivery speed and member outcomes
About You
You are a hands-on technical leader who can set direction and uplift standards, while partnering effectively with stakeholders across Technology and the business. You can explain complex data and cloud concepts in a clear, practical way and build strong relationships across teams.

What you'll bring:


Strong hands-on experience designing, building and operating modern Azure data platforms
Proven experience with Azure Databricks (Spark engineering, notebooks, performance optimisation, production support)
Experience building scalable batch/streaming pipelines using cloud-native patterns (Databricks, ADF, event-based ingestion)
Strong Azure fundamentals: networking, identity, security, resource management and cost optimisation
Experience with cloud data lakes (e.g., ADLS Gen2) and open formats such as Delta Lake
Exposure to MLOps / ML engineering practices on Azure
Agile/DevOps experience including CI/CD, IaC and automated testing
A coaching mindset and a focus on pragmatic delivery and operational excellence
Why UniSuper
We offer a range of benefits to support your mental, physical and financial wellbeing, including:


3 days over Christmas and 3 days 'Community and Culture' leave
The opportunity to choose between 17% and 12% superannuation
$1,500 personal development budget
Exceptional parental leave
At UniSuper, we value and celebrate diversity and inclusion in our workplace, where everyone can thrive. We believe that having a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, interests, abilities, and skills is crucial for delivering great retirement outcomes to our members. We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all the requirements listed.

Job Title: Software Engineer ‚Äì Simulation

Location: Newcastle or Canberra (Remote/Hybrid options available)

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent

About Us:

Applied Virtual Simulation (AVS) provides simulation technologies to the Australian Defence Force. We are a small, dynamic team and specialise in the development and delivery of immersive simulation-based training systems and software.

Job Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Software Engineer to join our team, with a focus on designing and developing software systems to support the delivery of our simulation-based training systems. In this role, you will report directly to a senior engineer and work collaboratively with a small but highly skilled team. Previous experience in developing or modding simulation software is highly desirable.

Key Responsibilities:

Be a key contributor to the detailed design, development, and integration of software for AVS' simulators and simulation projects.

Develop software applications, plugins, and components that are scalable and maintainable and integrate seamlessly with extant simulation software and codebases.

Collaborate with the software engineering team to develop and shape software subsystem design.

Work closely with stakeholders to gather technical requirements and translate them into functional solutions.

Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical challenges related to simulation-based training systems.

Stay updated with the latest trends in Defence simulation technologies and apply them to enhance system performance.

Qualifications:

Essential

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

3-5 years of software development experience, ideally in simulation-based training or Defence technologies.

Proven experience with designing and developing software systems.

Proficiency in C++, Lua, Scripting, and QML/Qt languages.

Understanding of software development lifecycle and principles, DevOps, and Agile methodologies.

Ability to obtain an Australian Security Clearance (up to NV1).

Preferred

Experience with Defence simulation engines such as VBS3/4 or MAK One.

Experience developing for commercial games engines, such as Unreal.

Experience using and developing with simulation interoperability standards, such as DIS or HLA.

Experience using and developing with operational system standards, such as VMF or C2Sim.

A strong understanding of Defence simulation requirements and standards is a plus.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Opportunities for professional growth and development in the Defence sector.

Flexible working hours and remote work options.

A collaborative, supportive team culture focused on innovation.

The chance to work on modern simulation technology in major Defence projects.
